name: Mount Redington

trails_config.name: Redington Bushwhack Loop
trails_config.description: One of the few bushwhack 4,000-footers in New England. Requires navigation skills to follow the herd paths to the canister at the summit.
trails_config.parking_info: Caribou Valley Road, Carrabassett Valley, ME

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of Maine's premier peaks, Mount Redington rises to 4010 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4010 feet, Mount Redington is a standout peak in Maine. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Redington Bushwhack Loop**, a **8.5 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **Maine 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **South Crocker Mountain**, which is just 1.8 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
